PHYSICS.content:
THE UNITED REPUBLIC OF TANZANIA
NATIONAL EXAMINATIONS COUNCIL OF TANZANIA
FORM FOUR NATIONAL ASSESSMENT
031 PHYSICS
(For both School and Private Candidates)
Time: 3 Hours

Instructions:
1. Answer all questions in the spaces provided.
2. Show all working clearly.
3. Section A carries 16 marks, Section B 60 marks, Section C 24 marks.
4. All writing must be in blue or black ink; diagrams in pencil.
5. Calculators and phones are not allowed.
6. Write your Assessment Number at the top right corner of every page.
7. Use g = 10 m/s², density of water = 1000 kg/m³ where necessary.

SECTION A (16 Marks)
1. Multiple Choice Questions (1 mark each)
(i) SI unit of pressure is
- A. Newton
- B. Pascal
- C. Watt
- D. Joule

(ii) Momentum is defined as
- A. mass × acceleration
- B. mass × velocity
- C. force × distance
- D. work done per unit time

(iii) A convex mirror always forms
- A. real, inverted image
- B. virtual, erect image
- C. real, erect image
- D. virtual, inverted image

(iv) Boiling occurs when
- A. vapor pressure equals atmospheric pressure
- B. temperature reaches melting point
- C. temperature is below freezing point
- D. heat is removed

(v) Ohm’s law states
- A. V ∝ I when R constant
- B. V = I²R
- C. P = IV
- D. Q = It

(vi) SI unit of electric charge is
- A. Coulomb
- B. Ampere
- C. Volt
- D. Ohm

(vii) Simple harmonic motion is characterized by
- A. acceleration constant
- B. force proportional to displacement and opposite in direction
- C. uniform velocity
- D. constant energy

(viii) Refraction is
- A. bending of light at a boundary between two media
- B. reflection of light from a mirror
- C. scattering of light
- D. interference of light

2. Match the following (1 mark each)
List A
(i) Law of conservation of momentum
(ii) Archimedes’ principle
(iii) Hooke’s law
(iv) Law of reflection
(v) Coulomb’s law

List B
A. Extension of spring ∝ applied force within elastic limit
B. Angle of incidence = angle of reflection
C. Upthrust = weight of fluid displaced
D. Total momentum before collision = total momentum after
E. Force between two charges ∝ product of charges / distance²

SECTION B (60 Marks)
3. Define power in physics and calculate power when 200 J of work is done in 5 s.

4. State Newton’s first law and explain inertia with an example.

5. Define latent heat of fusion. Calculate heat required to melt 0.5 kg of ice (Lf = 3.36 × 10^5 J/kg).

6. Draw a labelled parallel circuit with battery, two resistors and a switch. State two safety rules.

7. Explain factors affecting upthrust. A metal block (mass 15 kg, volume 0.01 m³) is placed in water. Determine if it floats and find upthrust.

8. A machine does 1200 J useful work with 1500 J energy supplied. Calculate efficiency.

9. Explain difference between series and parallel resistors in terms of total resistance and voltage.
Three resistors R1 = 4 Ω, R2 = 5 Ω, R3 = 10 Ω connected in parallel across 20 V battery. Calculate total resistance and total current.

10. Explain how a concave lens forms image of an object placed in front of it. Draw labelled diagram.

SECTION C (24 Marks)
11. (a) Describe experiment to determine focal length of concave mirror using distant object and screen.
    (b) Distance between mirror and screen = 18 cm. Find focal length.
    (c) State three characteristics of image when object is placed at 2F of concave mirror.

PAnswers.content:
SECTION A
1. Multiple Choice Answers
(i) B. Pascal — Pressure = force/area; SI unit = Pa.
(ii) B. Mass × velocity — Momentum = p = m v.
(iii) B. Virtual, erect image — Convex mirror always forms virtual, erect, diminished image.
(iv) A. Vapor pressure = atmospheric pressure — Boiling occurs when vapor pressure equals surrounding pressure.
(v) A. V ∝ I — Ohm's law: V = IR when R constant.
(vi) A. Coulomb — Electric charge unit.
(vii) B. Force ∝ displacement opposite direction — Simple harmonic motion.
(viii) A. Bending of light at boundary — Refraction.

2. Matching
(i) D; (ii) C; (iii) A; (iv) B; (v) E

SECTION B
3. Power
P = work / time = 200 / 5 = 40 W

4. Newton’s 1st Law
A body remains at rest or in uniform motion unless acted upon by net force. Example: Book stays on table until pushed.

5. Latent heat of fusion
Definition: Heat to change 1 kg of solid to liquid without temperature change.
Q = m Lf = 0.5 × 3.36 ×10^5 = 1.68 × 10^5 J

6. Parallel circuit: battery connected to two resistors in parallel with switch; safety: switch off before connecting, avoid touching live wires.

7. Upthrust
Depends on density of fluid and volume displaced.
- Volume block = 0.01 m³, mass = 15 kg
- Weight = 15 ×10 = 150 N
- Upthrust = ρ V g = 1000 ×0.01 ×10 = 100 N → Weight > Upthrust → sinks

8. Efficiency
η = 1200 /1500 ×100% = 80%

9. Series vs Parallel
Series: resistances add, current same; Parallel: 1/R_total = 1/4 + 1/5 + 1/10 = 0.25+0.2+0.1=0.55 → R_total ≈ 1.818 Ω
Total current I = V/R_total = 20 / 1.818 ≈ 11 A

10. Concave lens
Forms virtual, erect, diminished image on same side as object; diagram shows rays diverging through lens, extended backward to meet at virtual image.

SECTION C
11. Concave mirror experiment
(a) Place mirror, screen; point at distant object; move screen to get sharp image; measure distance = focal length.
(b) Measured distance = 18 cm → f ≈ 18 cm
(c) Object at 2F: image real, inverted, same size, located at 2F on opposite side.
